But the bright spot was the rapport the three judges had with one another, and the development of their ability to say "no to the more outrageous of the contestants. In his keynote speech Monday at the trade show, Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer rebutted that suggestion. "Nokia's support will help Windows Phone overall to build strength versus other mobile platforms," Steve Ballmer said. That's not just good for Nokia, that's good for all our handset partners. Steve Ballmer also demonstrated some of the improvements that are coming to Windows Phone 7 this year. They include a faster Web browser and quicker switching between applications.
